Plot the Euler pole solution

euler_plot.Rd

Creates a simple ggplot to show the best fit small/great circle, the data misfit to the solution and some statistics of the solution.

Usage

euler_plot(
  x,
  sc = TRUE,
  densify.x = FALSE,
  ...,
  proj = c("geo", "omerc", "stereo"),
  expand = c(0, 0)
)

Arguments

x

either a matrix or data.frame containing the geographical coordinates, or a sf object.

sc

logical. Whether the structure described by the points x is expected to follow small (TRUE) or great circle (FALSE) arcs?

densify.x

logical. Whether the points x along the lines structure should be densified before analysis (TRUE) or not (FALSE, the default). Densification would yield equally spaced points along the line.

...

optional arguments passed to smoothr::densify() (only if densify.x = TRUE).

proj

character. Whether the plot should be shown in the geographic Mercator projection ("geo", the default), the oblique Mercator projection with the Euler pole at North ("omerc"), or the stereographic projection centered in the Euler pole ("stereo").

expand

numeric two element vector. expand the map limits in latitude and longitude (c(0, 0) (degrees) by default)

Examples

data(tintina)
euler_plot(tintina)

euler_plot(tintina, proj = "omerc")


data(south_atlantic)
euler_plot(south_atlantic)

euler_plot(south_atlantic, proj = "omerc")

euler_plot(south_atlantic, proj = "stereo")
